business.headline: US, EU trade talks still on; atmanirbharta is resilient interdependence: SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday said efforts to finalise trade agreements with the US and the EU are in "full force."

Physicswallah IPO opens on November 11: Check price, size, GMP and key detailsThe wait is nearly over for investors tracking PhysicsWallah. The edtech firm will open its IPO on November 11, aiming to raise significant capital as it prepares for its stock market debut. Here's everything you need to know in simple terms.

Sensex, Nifty erase early gains to close lower, FII selling dampens marketThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 148.14 points to close at 83,311.01, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 87.95 points to end at 25,509.70.

Pine Labs IPO opens tomorrow for bidding: Check price band, GMP, other detailsPine Labs IPO involves the sale of 9.41 crore new shares aggregating to Rs 2,080 crore, while the offer for sale includes 8.23 crore shares worth Rs 1,819.91 crore, being sold by existing shareholders.

Shiv Nadar tops Hurun Philanthropy List 2025. Here's who else made the top 10Shiv Nadar and family have retained the top spot for the fourth time in five years. The HCL founder donated Rs 2,708 crore in 2025, averaging Rs 7.4 crore per day, up 26% from last year.

Is BPNL a lifesaver or a debt trap? The hidden side of easy credit, explains expertBuy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) has made shopping feel easier than ever — no paperwork, no waiting, just buy now and pay in instalments. But beneath the convenience lies a growing concern: is it really a smart money tool or a slippery debt trap? Let's have a look.

Reliance moves to sell Middle East crude as sanctions reshape trade: ReportThe company has reportedly offered grades such as Murban and Upper Zakum to both domestic and overseas buyers in recent days. While it is not yet clear how much crude Reliance is seeking to offload, the approach itself has caught the oil market's attention.

From ICICI, HDFC to SBI: Personal loan interest rates across 7 top banksIf you're planning to take a personal loan, comparing interest rates can save you a lot of money. Here's a quick look at what seven major banks, including SBI, ICICI, HDFC and Canara, are currently charging.

ED summons Anil Ambani for second time on November 14 in loan fraud caseHe was earlier summoned and interrogated by the ED in August 2025 as part of the ongoing probe into alleged financial irregularities involving loans taken by his group companies from Indian banks, including the State Bank of India (SBI).

Gold, silver prices are rising again. Is there more upside left?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), December gold futures hovered around Rs 1.20 lakh per 10 grams through the morning session, rebounding slightly from levels seen earlier this week. Silver saw a bigger gain after recent weakness and was trading at around Rs 1.47 lakh per kg.

Bihar Elections 2025: Who are the richest politicians contesting this time?Bihar, often seen as a political pulse point for national trends, is set for a two-phase election that will decide the leadership of a state rich in history and political influence.

Pension rules clarified: How does your last working day impact benefits?Under the Central Civil Services (Pension) Rules, 2021, an employee's pension will now be calculated based on the rules that are active on their final day of service. This could be the day they retire, resign, are discharged from duty, or pass away — whichever happens first.

Anil Ambani's Reliance Group faces government probe. What we know so farThe probe escalation follows aggressive enforcement actions by the ED. In the past week, the ED attached assets worth nearly Rs 7,500 crore in connection with alleged fund diversion.
M&M exits RBL Bank with stake sale worth Rs 6,780 croreM&M had acquired the stake in 2023 when the private sector lender was going through a period of regulatory scrutiny and leadership changes.

Paytm shares jump 4% despite Q2 profit slip. Here's whyPaytm's profit fell, but stronger operations and MSCI inflows kept investors optimistic. The coming quarters will show if this momentum can last.
Sensex opens 280 points higher, Nifty above 25,600; Asian Paints up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 202.50 points to 83,661.65, while the NSE Nifty50 added 27.55 points to 25,625.20 as of 9:31 am.

Should Sebi step in if IPO valuations are inflated?Experts say that while robust demand in IPOs reflects the growing maturity of India's equity market, the pattern of high valuations and subsequent weak listings suggests a need for more scrutiny.

Lenskart IPO allotment today: Here's how to check status and GMP before listingInvestors who applied for the Lenskart IPO can check their allotment status using either the BSE website or the registrar's porta,  MUFG Intime India Private Limited (formerly Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).
More trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group as government launches probeMore trouble for Anil Ambani's Reliance Group, Corporate Affairs ministry launches probe into fund diversion

Lenskart IPO GMP falls sharply before listing. Is it heading for a weak debut?Lenskart's IPO, which opened for subscription on October 31 and closed on November 4, received an overall subscription of 28.27 times, as per exchange data.

entertainment.headline: Michael to release in April 2026, Jaafar Jackson plays King of Pop. Watch trailer The trailer for the much-anticipated biopic 'Michael' is finally out. Starring Jaafar Jackson, the biopic will offer audiences a cinematic glimpse into the life of the King of Pop.

The Punch of Shiva documentary: Chiranjeevi, Prabhas, Rajamouli on RGV classic  As Telugu cinema's landmark film 'Shiva' gears up for its grand 4K Dolby Atmos re-release on November 14 2025, the makers have unveiled a special documentary titled 'The Punch of Shiva'.

Karan Johar admits feeling lonely at National Awards: Had no 'plus one' Filmmaker Karan Johar opened up about feeling lonely during significant career achievements, including his recent National Award win. The revelation came during his conversation with former Tennis player Sania Mirza on her podcast.

Aryan Khan to direct Shah Rukh Khan in 2027: Report The third project of Aryan Khan could reportedly feature Shah Rukh Khan in the lead role. The anticipated collaboration is expected to take shape in 2027, following the completion of Aryan's next film.

Emraan Hashmi: The Ba***ds of Bollywood would earn Rs 700 crore in theatres Actor Emraan Hashmi applauded Aryan Khan's daring Netflix series - 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' for its unique style. He said that the series could have been a major theatrical success and hopes to work with Shah Rukh Khan soon.

Aaromaley review: Refreshingly honest rom-com with heart and humourRelease Date:Fri Nov 07, 2025 Aaromaley movie review: Director Sarang Thiagu's 'Aaromaley', starring Kishen Das, Shivathmika and Harshath Khan, is a warm and fuzzy romantic entertainer that is all heart. Strong characterisations and realistic conversations make us look past minor shortcomings.

Shiamak Davar to choreograph Ranbir Kapoor in Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana. Details Choreographer Shiamak Davar has joined Nitesh Tiwari's ambitious two-part Ramayana, featuring Ranbir Kapoor, Sai Pallavi, and Yash. He expressed enthusiasm about working on the mythological epic in a recent interview.

Nuremberg review: Russell Crowe shines in courtroom epic that lacks emotional depthRelease Date:Sat Nov 01, 2025 'Nuremberg' is technically superb, showcasing the moral weight of history, but the drama rarely moves beyond the obvious. Though Russell Crowe gives a commanding performance, the film ultimately feels too safe, lacking the psychological crackle and moral reckoning it deserves.

Actor Lee Si Young gives birth to second child via IVF, calls baby God's gift Actor Lee Si Young has announced the birth of her second child, a daughter, one day after giving birth. The actor used her Instagram account to share photos and a message expressing her gratitude and reflecting on her journey, which included IVF and navigating major life changes after her divorce earlier this year.

I Am Not An Actor director on film's message: Accept people as they are Director Aditya Kripalani shared that his film 'I Am Not An Actor' highlights the need for human connection. The story explores loneliness and mental health through a retired banker's online connection with a struggling actor.

Vishwak Sen's Funky gets release date, KV Anudeep's comedy set for April 2026 After receiving an enthusiastic response to its teaser, the makers of 'Funky' have officially announced the film's release date. Directed by KV Anudeep and starring Vishwak Sen and Kayadu Lohar, the comedy entertainer is set to release in April 2026.

Allu Arjun to collaborate with Sanjay Leela Bhansali and SS Rajamouli? Details inside  After the blockbuster success of the 'Pushpa' franchise, Allu Arjun's name continues to dominate social media. The actor is reportedly lining up collaborations with some of India's biggest filmmakers, including Sanjay Leela Bhansali, Prashanth Neel and SS Rajamouli.

The Manipulated review: Ji Chang-wook and D.O are reason enough to watchRelease Date:Wed Nov 05, 2025 'The Manipulated' follows a deliveryman caught in a criminal conspiracy. The series explores themes of betrayal and manipulation with gripping performances.

Why Anurag Kashyap won't buy Audi or other luxury cars Bollywood celebs own Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap opens up about his preference for a disciplined lifestyle, owning just one car, and his approach to filmmaking with limited resources.

Aditya Sarpotdar defends dance numbers in Thamma as marketing assets Director Aditya Sarpotdar responds to criticism over three dance numbers in 'Thamma'. He emphasises these songs serve as marketing assets and aid story progression, not just entertainment.

Neeraj Ghaywan opens up on Homebound, Dalit voices and the road to the Oscars Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' has been selected as India's official entry to the Oscars this year. The director shared his reaction to the news and reflected on the significance of the film's journey, as well as the broader issues of representation in Indian cinema.

Judge again dismisses Blake Lively's case against social media agent Jed Wallace A federal judge has again dismissed Blake Lively's claims against Jed Wallace, citing insufficient connection to New York, while leaving open the possibility of legal action in Texas. The case concerning allegations of an orchestrated online smear campaign narrows as trial approaches for other defendants.

First Copy 2 review: Munawar's risky business gets messier and more magneticRelease Date:Wed Nov 05, 2025 'First Copy Season 2' is now streaming on MX Player, continuing Arif's intense journey in the piracy world. The series explores complex relationships and underworld conflicts with a cliffhanger ending, hinting at more drama.

Rashmika Mandanna-Vijay Deverakonda wedding date and place fixed? Read here Reportedly, Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding may take place at a palace in Udaipur in February, following their private engagement in Hyderabad last month. A wedding date is also doing the rounds.

general news.headline: Dead, duplicated: What a 'Brazilian' face reveals about Haryana voter listIndia Today visited Rai constituency to investigate Rahul Gandhi's allegations of widespread voter fraud in the 2024 Haryana elections, claiming a Brazilian model's photo was used under multiple names. Here's what we found.

At 64.66%, Bihar phase 1 polling witnesses highest-ever voter turnout  Live UpdatesBihar election 2025: Bihar's phase 1 elections saw a historic voter turnout of 64.66%, the highest ever in the state's history. In 2020, the Mahagathbandhan, led by the RJD, had the upper hand in these constituencies.

Cultural fascism: Protests in Dhaka as Yunus govt bows to Islamists on musicTeachers and students of Dhaka University and Jagannath University protested against the Yunus administration's decision to junk posts of music and physical education teachers in public schools. The decision to drop the posts followed fierce pushback from several Islamist organisations who called the move "un-Islamic".

Haryana woman whose voter roll entry carried Brazil model's pic died in 2022The voter, Guniya, had died more than two years ago. Her family said they were shocked to discover that her name still appeared on the voter list, and that, too, with the photo of a foreign woman.

Mamdani went where Obama, Nikki Haley, Bobby Jindal and JD Vance did not dare to goMamdani's victory is significant because he didn't play down his Muslim, or migrant identity, unlike other political aspirants in America and other Western countries had done in the past.

Afghanistan claims Pak breached ceasefire, fired on border forces amid peace talksTaliban spokesperson Zabihullah Mujahid said Afghan forces refrained from responding to avoid civilian casualties. The incident follows Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif's warning that failure of the talks could lead to war.

You are drunk: Bihar Deputy CM, RJD leader spar on road over convoy attack - VideoA day of polling in Bihar's Lakhisarai turned volatile as Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha and RJD MLC Ajay Kumar engaged in a heated on-camera altercation, trading accusations of drunken misconduct and voter bribery.

Rahul Gandhi's '223 votes' claim leads to Haryana village that voted for CongressRahul Gandhi has claimed that there were 223 identical entries in a booth in Haryana during the 2024 elections. The booth is part of the constituency where Congress significantly improved its vote share.

PM Modi serves food to wheelchair-bound Pratika Rawal at champions' meet in DelhiPrime Minister Narendra Modi was seen serving food to Pratika Rawal, who was on a wheelchair during the felicitation ceremony for Women's World Cup winners in New Delhi on Wednesday.

As a gut specialist, this is what I think bloating says about your healthGastrointestinal distress should not be ignored. When identified and managed early, they can make all the difference in preventing serious complications.

Vreels: A Game-Changing Platform Pushing Social Media Beyond TikTok and InstagramVreels isn't just about sharing, it's about connecting meaningfully. Through built-in chat, voice, and video call features, users can communicate without leaving the app.

Singer and former actor Sulakshana Pandit dies at 71Sulakshana Pandit, known for her roles in the 1970s Indian cinema and her prolific singing career, died on Thursday at the age of 71. She leaves behind a legacy spanning film, music, and memorable collaborations.

Rashmika Mandanna-Vijay Deverakonda wedding date and place fixed? Read hereReportedly, Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding may take place at a palace in Udaipur in February, following their private engagement in Hyderabad last month. A wedding date is also doing the rounds.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

How do voters' photos get changed? Know from booth-level officers themselvesCongress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged electoral fraud in the Haryana Assembly election, showing that a Brazilian model's image had been used for 22 voters in the state. Booth-level officers (BLOs) explain how voter IDs are verified, the challenges they face, and how errors, such as photo mismatches, can happen.

Blatant theft: AAP accuses BJP MP of voting in Delhi and Bihar; he refutes chargeThe controversy comes a day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged that the BJP carried out "voter theft" in the 2024 Haryana polls, claiming that the same photograph of a Brazilian model appeared multiple times on voter ID cards.

The series explores complex relationships and underworld conflicts with a cliffhanger ending, hinting at more drama.

Can't call others fraud: High Court raps Patanjali over 'dhokha' chyawanprash adHearing a plea by Dabur India seeking an injunction against the ad, the Delhi High Court observed that while Patanjali could claim superiority, it could not denigrate others.

Left wins all 4 seats in JNUSU polls, bags president, vice-president postsAISA's Aditi Mishra was elected President, defeating ABVP's Vikas Patel by a margin of over 400 votes. Mishra secured 1,861 votes against Patel's 1,447, continuing AISA's stronghold over the top post.

Brazilian photographer deletes account after vote chori image rowA photo clicked by Matheus Ferrero in 2017 sparked a political storm after Rahul Gandhi alleged it appeared on multiple voter ID cards in last year's Haryana elections.

Aryan Khan's rumoured Brazilian partner Larissa Bonesi trends amid Haryana vote rowBrazilian model Larissa Bonesi has been wrongly identified as the woman shown by Rahul Gandhi in his Haryana 'vote chori' press conference. She is rumoured to be close to Shah Rukh Khan's son and debutant director Aryan Khan.

With Guru Nanak's blessing, friends from India and Pakistan meet after 78 yearsDespite closed borders and political tensions between India and Pakistan, people from the two countries meet at Kartarpur and Nankana Sahib on Guru Nanak Jayanti. Pakistan allowed 2,000 pilgrims from India on the occasion of Guru Nanak's Gurupurab. Two friends separated by the Partition, met for the first time in 78 years.

India trade flair for precision to skittle Australia in tacky Gold CoastAustralia (AUS) vs India (IND), 4th T20I: India did not need a flamboyant show on a sluggish pitch that resembled home in Gold Coast on Thursday. Riding on a solid batting show and a disciplined bowling performance, India sealed a 48-run win.

Pak exposed again: Shehbaz Sharif's aide visits office of Hafiz Saeed's outfitSenator and Minister of State for Interior, Talal Chaudhry, visited the PMML House in Faisalabad, about 130 km from Lahore, where he was welcomed by leaders of the political party.

sports.headline: Steve Waugh ends the debate, calls Virat Kohli greatest ODI player of all time Legendary Australia captain has named Virat Kohli as the best ODI cricketer in history. Kohli is the second-highest run scorer in the 50-over format with 14,255 runs, including a record 51 centuries.

Cristiano Ronaldo reveals why he did not attend Diogo Jota's funeral Cristiano Ronaldo explains why he chose not to attend Diogo Jota's funeral, saying his presence would have shifted attention away from the grieving family during an emotional time.

Winning the World Cup was destiny, God had already written this: Deepti Sharma All-rounder Deepti Sharma reflected on the team's Women's World Cup 2025 triumph and said the win was written in destiny and God had already planned it.

PM Modi noticing my lord Hanuman tattoo and Insta bio meant a lot: Deepti Sharma India all-rounder Deepti Sharma shares her excitement after meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The PM acknowledged her Lord Hanuman tattoo and Instagram bio, highlighting her unique connection with the leader.

I was trying to improve my bowling, it was not happening: Shivam Dube Australia vs India, 4th T20I: Shivam Dube credited Gautam Gambhir, Suryakumar Yadav and Morne Morkel for helping him improve his bowling skills. Dube took two crucial wickets in India's 48-run win in Gold Coast on Thursday, November 6.

Bindaas bowling daal: Shivam Dube enjoys Gautam Gambhir's trust in secondary skill AUS vs IND, 2nd T20I: Once seen as only a middle-order hitter, Shivam Dube is finally earning the trust he waited years for with the ball. Backed by Gautam Gambhir, guided by Morne Morkel and captained by Suryakumar Yadav, Dube is getting opportunities to bowl under pressure and test himself.

Sheetal Devi makes history, selected for India's able-bodied junior archery team World champion para archer Sheetal Devi makes history by earning selection to India's able-bodied junior archery team after finishing third at national trials.

IND A vs SA A: Jurel makes big statement before South Africa series with 132 India A recovered from a severe top-order collapse to post 255 all out against South Africa A, thanks to a composed, unbeaten 132 from Dhruv Jurel. Kuldeep Yadav added valuable support with a gritty 20 as the pair rebuilt the innings after the team slumped to 126 for 7.

WPL 2026: Full list of players retained and released by all five teams The field is set as the five franchises have retained their players ahead of the upcoming Women's Premier League 2026 auction. The franchise aims for a fresh start with a clean slate and the biggest auction purse for the 2026 season.

Did Pratika receive Women's World Cup winner's medal after ICC rule change? Pratika Rawal, initially denied a medal due to ICC rules despite her significant role in India's Women's World Cup victory, was later seen wearing the medal in a photo with President Draupadi Murmu. Rawal was India's second-highest run scorer of the tournament with 308 runs from six innings.

After World Cup win, Harmanpreet sacrifices Rs 1 crore, slips to MI's 2nd retentionMumbai Indians opted to make a rather interesting call by retaining the captain, Harmanpreet Kaur as their second-choice pick at Rs 2.5 crore and giving the top spot to the England all-rounder, Nat Sciver-Brunt.

Axar Patel credits slow pitch, unexpected bounce for match-winning spellIndia all-rounder Axar Patel credited the slow surface and unexpected bounce at the Carrara Oval following his match-winning all-round show in the fourth T20I against Australia.

WPL retentions: Deepti Sharma, Sree Charani among big India World Cup stars releasedWomen's World Cup 2025 Player Of The Tournament Deepti Sharma and Sree Charani were among the big names released by their respective franchises during the WPL 2026 retentions. The likes of Renuka Thakur and Kranti Goud will also be looking for new teams.

Chapman stars as New Zealand survive West Indies onslaught for 2nd T20I winA late fightback from Rovman Powell and the West Indies lower order was not enough as Kyle Jamieson defended seven runs in the final four balls, handing New Zealand a three-run victory and levelling the T20I series. Mark Chapman was the star of the show with the bat for the Blackcaps in the first innings.

Gukesh and Arjun Erigaisi advance on day of major upsetsThe Chess World Cup saw some dominant performances from the likes of Arjun Erigaisi, Gukesh, as well as other strong contenders in Vincent Keymer and Anish Giri, but there were some major upsets in the form of Ian Nepomniachthchi and Wesley So getting eliminated.

Why is Ruturaj Gaikwad not in T20I scene? Ashwin questions Indian team managementR Ashwin has asked why Ruturaj Gaikwad isn't in the T20I scene for India after being a consistent performer in the IPL. Ruturaj last played for India during the Zimbabwe tour right after the T20 World Cup 2024 win.

Babarfication of Shubman Gill: Vice-captain trolled after sluggish 4th T20I knockIND vs AUS: Shubman Gill faced criticism after a sluggish 46 in the fourth T20I against Australia in Gold Coast on Thursday, November 6. The vice-captain has struggled to get going in the ongoing series.

Cummins set for Test return in 2nd Ashes Test as injury concerns loomAustralia captain Pat Cummins is set to return to Test cricket in the 2nd Ashes Test. Cummins has however said that he might not play all matches after that.

AIFF pulls big surprise, calls up two Indian-origin players to India camp: ReportsThe AIFF has taken its first real step toward widening India's player pool by inviting Ryan Williams and Abneet Bharti to the national camp. Their inclusion signals the federation's growing commitment to bringing Indian-origin talent into the fold.

Tata Motors to gift new Sierra SUV to Women's World Cup-winning Indian teamWomen's World Cup 2025: Tata Motors announced on Thursday that the soon-to-be-launched Tata Sierra SUV will be gifted to each member of the winning team. India defeated South Africa in the final to clinch the title on Sunday, November 2.

AUS vs IND: Maxwell back for 4th T20I, Sanju Samson continues to warm benchGlenn Maxwell has made a comeback to the Australia T20I side for the fourth match against India. On the other hand, Sanju Samson continued to warm the bench as India named an unchanged playing XI.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
